results.name: a(0) = 0; for n >= 1, a(n) = A000035(n) + a(A257684(n)); in the factorial representation of n the number of digits with maximal possible value allowed in its location.
comment: In the factorial representation of n, given as {d_k, ..., d_3, d_2, d_1}, the maximal allowed digit for any position j is j. This sequence gives how many digits in the whole representation [A007623(n)] attain that maximum allowed value.
link: Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
formula: a(n!-1) = n-1. [n!-1 gives also the first position where n-1 occurs.]
example: For n=19, which has factorial representation "301", the digits at position 1 and 3, namely "1" and "3" are equal to their one-based position index, in other words, the maximal digits allowed in those positions (while "0" at position 2 is not), thus a(19) = 2.
